action: For strating the game and completing the first activity!
message: Hello Nurse! — The first step is always to start. Welcome!

action: For identifying the water puddles as a malaria health risk.
message: For spotting the puddles of water and seeing them as potential breeding areas for mosquitoes. Well Done!

action: For spotting a bed without an ITN as a malaria health risk.
message: You're looking out for your community members and making sure they sleep soundly and safely, free from mosquitoes. Well Done!

action: For knowing the correct process for hanging an ITN
message: There may be things you don’t know — no one is perfect — but nobody can say you can’t hang an ITN net. Bravo!

action: For making a correct diagnosis of Uncomplicated Malaria
message: Wow, is anyone able to recognize uncomplicated malaria as easily as you? We don't think so. For that, you deserve a badge!

action: For observing best practices for supervising CBAs/Volunteers
message: Volunteers and CBAs are confident of being able to take charge of most basic situations around malaria, and they’re  happy to have a good supervisor like you. Keep up the Good Work!

action: For completing the Community Health Scenario
message: CONGRATULATIONS Nurse!You deserve this, go celebrate your hardwork!
